website_summaries.verdict: Ordering one large rug pad and cutting it to specific dimensions does make economic sense. Rubber mat will not stain or damage hardwood floors. Solid brand name in adhesive product lines.
pros: Large 6-foot by 9-foot rubber and felt pad arrives rolled, not folded or creased
Can be easily cut to fit other dimensions
Felt layer is hypoallergenic and condensed stitched for durability and sound reduction
cons: Felt layer does not grip bottom of rug securely
Size dimensions may not be accurate
1/4-inch depth is not as plush as some users may expect

customer_reviews.title: Best Rug Mat Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I never do reviews but this is AMAZING. I tried two other options for keeping my rug in place on my pergo floors (mat and tape) I took a chance on this and it was worth every penny. the rug does not budge! and to put things in perspective.... I have a 150 lb great dane and an energetic 7 year old who like to chase each other around the house and roll around on the floor. I am so happy with it. Previously i was readjusting the rug ever 10 minutes when the dog ran through the room, and since putting down this mat I havent had to touch it.
customer_reviews.author: Larrisa

customer_reviews.title: Trashed my floor
customer_reviews.text: Loved the product until I realized what it has done to my floors. Very upsetting. No moisture or anything like that. Rubber leaves residue.
customer_reviews.author: Hari S Bernstein

customer_reviews.title: Larger sized mats not stored properly
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based on the 1,200 4 1/2 star reviews. Not sure what all the fuss is about. Maybe the problem is with the larger size. I ordered a 7' X 10' and it shipped folded in half and rolled up, rubber sides back to back. Obviously stored this way in a very hot climate/warehouse for a very long time because the rubber sides were completely stuck to each other and had to be pried apart. You could hear a ripping noise and see the rubber backing had started to breakdown. Part of the rubber grip was pulled off when I ripped the two sides apart. Grip and rubber obviously compromised, returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you should buy
customer_reviews.text: I searched so many reviews and products and finally landed on this one. I love it. Rubber grip on the bottom latches on to my wood floor. It was easy to unroll. No smell. It needed to be cut by a smidge. Nothing crazy. My husband was able to run a razor blade easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jen E

customer_reviews.title: Have no fear
customer_reviews.text: After a trip to Home Depot, and reading many reviews online, there seemed be a great deal of dissatisfaction with these non slip rug products. So it was with some trepidation that I ordered the 8 X 10. It really does the trick. My oriental does not move and the padding makes it plush. My rug was a bit smaller, so I trimmed off some of the pad using regular scissors, put together the pieces using duct tape, and used it on a smaller 2' 8" X 5' oriental in the hallway, that never stayed put. Well, this was the TRUE TEST, and this small rug stays in place. Order this without fear.
customer_reviews.author: RICHARD KENNEDY

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Less than half the cost of a very similar rug pad acquired from a local furniture store, The Original Gorilla Grip Felt + Rubber rug pad not only provides great cushioning but also outstanding grip and non-slip security. I paid nearly double the cost of this pad at the furniture store where I bought my rugs and I certainly regret doing that. These are every bit as good and there is absolutely no visible difference between the expensive furniture store pads and these. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Captain Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Damaged, Soiled & Smelled Bad!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived sealed in plastic, however was sent stupidly folded in half and rolled up, and therefore had a deep groove and wrinkles lengthwise that ruined the smoothness of the pad. On the rubber side there were 3 spots of some unknown substance which was very off-putting, making one think some glue had leaked through or it was soiled-the overall rubber side of the pad was dirty! Also, the rubber side smelled unbelievably bad! I have ordered similar pads from a rug cleaning business that were in perfect condition with no bad smells. This product was completely unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: So I bought a 5'7 and I think it was a couple inches bigger which is good because I think it gives you a little leeway ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought rug pads before and they always shed these little foam pieces everywhere. This rug pad from the moment I un-rolled it to laying it down I did not feel any sort of dust from it and didn't feel the immediate need to wash my hands. It does come a little bit larger than what you buy. So I bought a 5'7 and I think it was a couple inches bigger which is good because I think it gives you a little leeway in your measurements. I had to trim about 4 inches off so the pad wasn't poking out of the rug. But overall I love this purchase and it looks like great quality.
customer_reviews.author: LB87

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT hold rugs in place!
customer_reviews.text: The pad sticks to the floor fine but the rugs that are laid on top of them slide off the top of the pad several times a day. These rug pads do not hold the rugs in place.
customer_reviews.author: Curley Sue

customer_reviews.title: Extra thick?
customer_reviews.text: The title for this item describes it as "extra thick" and "plush". i'm not sure where those descriptions come from because this item upon it's arrival cannot be described as "extra thick" nor "plush". I purchased this pad to go under a large area rug for my children's bedroom. You cannot tell the difference in comfort from when it is under the rug or not. There is no added cushion provided, the only benefit is the nonskid side of the pad which will help prevent my area rug from moving. That is the only benefit that can determine. If you want any cushion at all under your area rug, I suggest purchasing a different pad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice pad
customer_reviews.text: Pad is thick and provides nice cushion for my 5x7 carpet. It doesn't slide around on the hardwood floor. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with the type of rug I have
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s the type of rug I have or what, I have a vintage hemp woven Turkish rug that’s pretty thin so I bought this to go under it hoping it would help keep it in place and it didn’t. It works very well sticking to the floor without leaving any marks or anything but the rug doesn’t stay on top of it so it moves around just as much. I ended up not using it which is a bummer because it was really pricey for a rug pad. I’ll bet different types of rugs work better with it but if you have a thinner fabric rug this may not be the best
customer_reviews.author: Evy Rose

customer_reviews.title: Not Plush at All
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why there are so many glowing reviews for how plush this "extra thick" rug pad is. It's not very plush at all and only provides minimal cushion support. I'm giving it 3 stars because I feel that this was falsley marketed for its plushness and there are way too many reviews about how soft this is supposed to be. It's only 1/4: thick... The nice things are that the non-slip works great and it's cut slightly smaller than the rug size (e.g. an 8'x10' rug mats fits under an 8'x10' rug) and no cutting was required.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Finally, somthing that works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 x 5 oval rug on the ceramic floor of my entrance way. I also have a very active dog that runs to the front door windows to bark at anyone or thing passing by. My past life has been one of repositioning the rug multiple times during the day. I've tried several cheaper mats and none of them worked. Very frustrating. This mat holds my rug in place regardless of my dog's gyrations. Very happy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Herholz Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Roll was 4" shorter than advertised
customer_reviews.text: 9'8" is not the same as 10', which put a hitch in my project. The product itself seems fine but I would not buy again from these guys - either it's a petty ripoff, or they're just sloppy. Either way, no good.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Does not grip my hardwood floor
customer_reviews.text: I have given this rug mat 2 stars because it seems to be well constructed, and it does provide a small amount of cushion. The main reason I purchased this mat is because of the word “gripper” in the description. This rug pad does not grip my hardwood floors nor does the top of the mat completely grip the underside of my area rug. I have to reposition the rug repeatedly. I would have been so much better off buying a cheap mesh gripper pad. Really dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: elizfbp

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you really want this as you have to pay return shipping!!
customer_reviews.text: The quality was OK, but I ordered a 2 X 10, and received a 2 X 8. The label on the package even said it was 2 X 10!! It is very thick, so make sure your rug is not in the way of a door, as the door will not be able to go over the thickness of the pad and the rug.
customer_reviews.author: Julia D Zerkel

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Have Enough Grip and Was Too Thick!
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this rug pad under the rug at my front door. It was too thick. I could barely get my front door open. Also, it had absolutely no grip. the rug was moving around everywhere. I ened up throwing the rug pad away. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: Love the cushion it provides
customer_reviews.text: Love the cushion it provides, and grips the rugs with normal people traffic. Dog traffic (3 medium size dogs) -gripping just not there to keep the rugs in place on our wood flooring. I then added the Rug Corner Plastic Grips I purchased thru Amazon to help with the dog traffic. They stayed on first to the rug itself and after a few days - lost their grip to the rug - gripped to our wood flooring and after removal of them, they left a medium glue residual on our flooring. I used Mr. Clean to remove the residual.
customer_reviews.author: John Cox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I did have to use carpet tape to make the rug stick to the pad but once stuck together the carpet does not move! I did need to cut the pad to fit the length of the runner. My cheap thin runner now feels thick and soft and won’t slide everywhere even with kids and a dog running around!
customer_reviews.author: Shoptillidrop

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't damage floors
customer_reviews.text: I love the backing on this as it works super well to keep rugs from slipping but doesn't leave marks on the floor or stick to it like the waffle weave pads do (which left damage on my wooden floors after only being on them for a few months, and the floors were older and well cured). This pad hasn't left a single mark on my newly refinished floors even though I put them down only two months after refinishing when the finish still isn't 100% cured. Very happy with them. They aren't the cushiest though, so if you have a thin rug you might still want a plush pad on top of this.
customer_reviews.author: Stapayr8485

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Just spend the money and buy this if you want a solution for area rugs sliding all over the place. I have a gigantic doberman puppy who used to fling my large area all over my wood floor, even with other, cheaper rug grips underneath. Not anymore! This does the job and now my rug stays firmly in place despite my rambunctious maniac dog's best efforts.
customer_reviews.author: britmar12

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the floor protected and rug stays put
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these last year for my daughters room because she was wanting a rug in her newly remodeled room. I had to cut it to fit since the rug was a 4 x 6 but that was no problem. The rug has stayed put since June of last year with all the kids going in and out of her room and also our cats. I liked it so much that I purchased another one for a spare room I remodeled. I only had to trim a little off the end for the 5 x 8 rug. If I need another one I will be def purchasing this brand again
customer_reviews.author: 96blackstang

customer_reviews.title: Great for most uses
customer_reviews.text: These floor mats are wonderful. They have added extra cushion under throw rugs throughout our house. They are too think of you want to have a runner style rug near a door that would need to swing over the rug. The thickness has also made it more difficult for our Roomba to go over the area rugs as it sometimes gets off balance and stops due to the thickness.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Z

customer_reviews.title: Not worth what we paid for it.
customer_reviews.text: The product is fine. The size is accurate. It has rubber on the bottom and felt on the top as described. The quality is ok. It is definitely not worth the price. I don't mind paying a lot for something that is worth it and high quality, but in my opinion, it is worth about $60 bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Allie

customer_reviews.title: Effective, reliable, and not stinky
customer_reviews.text: After buying yet another Gorilla rug pad, I realize I should let others know how great these pads are. I'm very chemically sensitive, and I like these because they don't have a bad off-gassing odor like you get with other pads. They stay in place, are soft, and add that little bit of comfort that suddenly my family and guests start sitting on the floor for game/movie nights. I like that they come in huge sizes and can be easily cut to size.
customer_reviews.author: J Crista

customer_reviews.title: Good padding and Non-Slip
customer_reviews.text: I bought an 8x10' pad and cut it to fit under my 7.5x9.5' rug. Cutting it was a bear, because the pad is thick, so make sure you have sharp scissors and some patience (I rubbed a blister on a finger doing so). Once you get it in place it's really nice! It has a nice medium-firm feel to it, hides well under the rug, and keeps the rug in place. I'll probably take their recommendation to use double-sided tape to tape down the corners later, but for now, it's doing great. I ended up buying another one for a smaller rug, I'd highly recommend this pad.
customer_reviews.author: ASDF

customer_reviews.title: The rug stays put, and feels better!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect, we had purchased a rug for our new baby and out tow 100 lb dogs kept running in the room and pushing the rug around on the wood floor. This has stopped that all together! A bonus to that is that it has added some padding to the rug giving it a much more plush and luxurious feel. I definitely recommend for anyone with a rug that will not stay put or has the corners continuously roll over on you.
customer_reviews.author: R Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Quality padding and no smell!
customer_reviews.text: I got the Gorilla Grip rug pad about two months ago. So far it has worked really well. No smell when I took it out of the wrapping it was delivered in. It was a little bigger then the area rug I got it for but was easily cut to size with regular scissors. The padding appears to be well made and makes the rug nice and cushiony when walking on it. I am liking this pad better then the old flat rubber pad I used to have under the rug. The rug stays in place and doesn't slid off the pad. Really good product!
customer_reviews.author: beach girl

customer_reviews.title: Comfy Underfoot
customer_reviews.text: After looking at several pads I chose this one based on other reviews and the fact it has a non-slip rubber backing, as well the "green" aspect of its construction. It comes rolled up instead of folded so there are no creases. I have hard concrete floors in my house and wanted both the safety of a non-slip pad and the comfort of a nice cushion underfoot. This provides both. I've tried lots of other rug pads in the past but this will be my go-to source for safe comfortable rug pads from now on. I'm very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: margie588

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of flat woven rugs that are always shifting due to foot traffic and cat playing. I bought this to see if it would work better than those mesh type rug pads and it truly made a huge difference. I’m the weeks since I bought this I’ve only had to fix one corner once. I like that it comes bigger than you need so you can cut it down, although it is difficult to cut, still worth it. I bought another for the second rug too. The rugs just look nicer with this underneath as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would say this is an excellent felt pad
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is an excellent felt pad. It did improve the softness of my runner. Only problem I had with it is my rug kept sliding off of it. I finally put the old rubber pad I had back under my runner. I will keep it cut it to size and try using it with other rugs I have in my home. Not sure why it would not keep my rug in place.
customer_reviews.author: Justy

customer_reviews.title: Solid feeling, So and so grip on hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: I've been living with the product since this past summer. I have it on hardwood flooring underneath a dense and thin Turkish rug. I like the thickness of the pad and the feeling under my feet. However, I have to readjust it once a week. Regular transit and vacuuming will slightly displace it, and if you have energetic dogs, then it will get moved for sure. On the other hand, I appreciate that the backing is not leaving any marks on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: JRA

customer_reviews.title: Turned a rug over hardwood into a comfortable area to enjoy.
customer_reviews.text: We have a large plush rug over a hardwood floor. It looked soft, but playing on it with the kids was torture on the knees, butt, etc. we ordered the gorilla grip( 1/2” I believe) and it has made all the difference. While the felt is a bit thin for performing wrestling moves, it has made the rug over a hardwood floor a great place to lay, map, sit, crawl, kneel, build, and even stand. I can’t speak to the non-slip aspect because the couch holds it in place, but I think the grippy side will halo hold the felt together over the long run.
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: These are great especially under thin rugs and or indoor outdoor carpeting
customer_reviews.text: THESE PAD ARE A PERFECT SOLUTION: I was looking for the perfect pad because I recently broke my hip by slipping on dog slobber in my kitchen I’ve had pads before but they are too thin and too sticky, and simply not enough to offer any protection These are form enough so you won’t slip but soft and “grippy” enough to decrease the chance of fracture and:or tripping also they make indoor outdoor carpeting look luxurious
customer_reviews.author: BBH

customer_reviews.title: Best rug pad I have found
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pads I have found yet. Don't buy the skimpy ones that have the netting appearance. These are worth the $. Also, I had excellent customer service from the company. Be careful what size you order and contact the company if it isn't exactly what you need. For a braided wool rug, I would recommend cutting the pad to be exactly the size of the rug.
customer_reviews.author: June Cleaver

customer_reviews.title: Great pad but make sure to buy the right size
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice, thick pad that does keep the rug in place on wood floors, even with two dogs wrestling their way down the hall on it. I have a 2'x12' runner and the longest that this pad came in is 2'x10'. So there are two fairly pronounced bumps in the runner. I wish they had one that is 2' longer. Other reviewers have found a solution by purchasing shorter ones and taping them together, but (for me) I'm not sure it's worth the extra cost and work.
customer_reviews.author: ABSACTO

customer_reviews.title: Radically overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Would never overpay for something like this again. Much better less expensive options.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Thick and immovable by humans.
customer_reviews.text: My dog can move the small 2 by 4 rug with the gorilla grip but not the large one. (Playing catch) When I vacuum I have to flip it up in order to get underneath. I can not move it by pushing with my foot. This would be comfortable to stand on for a long time IMHO. I have had knee surgery and you can feel the difference standing on it. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I Ordered  Another One
customer_reviews.text: I knew absolutely nothing about rug pads prior to this purchase. After installing a new laminate floor I picked up a "temporary" area rug for my living room. I say "temporary " because it was so inexpensive I figured I would replace it before long and get something nicer. Knowing I needed a pad I went to Amazon and found this one. It sounded good, so I ordered it. This thing is great and makes my cheap rug feel and look like it's so much nicer than it really is. Arrived quickly, no slip, lays flat, cushions floor, and nice to sit or lie on, too. It's worked out so well I bought another one for the dining room.
customer_reviews.author: Jelly-bean

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't slip at all!
customer_reviews.text: Came bigger than the dimensions listed which was nice because I could cut it to size for the rug. It is on my kitchen ceramic tile floor and it hasn't moved. Definitely the best rug backing I've ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Jillian Helms

customer_reviews.title: Holds on rugs in place and an extra bonus!
customer_reviews.text: We bought a a couple non-stick rugs for our hardwood floor kitchen and need something to keep our rugs from sliding out from under our feet. After several products we found the gorilla grip mat perfect to hold the rugs in place and we got an added bonus with these also having a little extra padding to make the rugs even softer on our feet. A win win!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased an 8x10 rug pad. Cost was almost twice of other felt pads that I was looking at, but this one had the rubber backing and better reviews than the cheaper products. I'm glad I selected this one. It arrived very quickly and I was very pleased that it did have any smell/off-gassing once unwrapped. It also appears to be very high quality. One thing to note was that it did come folded and then rolled (likely due to the 8x10 size) so there was a crease down the middle, but this was unnoticeable once under the rug.
customer_reviews.author: Clf13

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product is great!! We have a three legged dog who is afraid to walk on wood floors, but we don't want to put down carpet. We bought throw rugs, but they slipped around and scared her worse. So, bought this to try solve the problem. This works. The throw rugs stay in place and she is no longer afraid to walk across them. My only "gripe" is that the pad is very thick. Can't use next to doors because then they won't open. Otherwise I would have given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: OldBatRN

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rug pad
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rug pad. Grips the floor and stays in place. We had to do a small amount of trimming, but expected that. Well made and does its job better than the less expensive ones we've had in the past. Would definitely purchase again. A note about the seller: excellent communication and rapid shipping. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thick, Quality Grippy Pad
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice, thick, very grippy pad. Our rug hasn't moved even a half inch since we put this down. It's like it's glued to the floor, though it doesn't stick at all since you can pick it right up if you want. Plus, it adds some nice padding. It's not too bad to cut with a good pair of kitchen shears or a utility blade, but it's not easy either. Just go slow and you'll be fine. It's obvious that this is a quality product. I trimmed mine to my rug and am going to piece the remnant together and duct tape the seam to go under a smaller rug that I have, which is a bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Nick777

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, grip, installation
customer_reviews.text: The pad was for a 4x6 braided rug. Without the pad, it was very slippery on a wood floor and would not hold shape. The pad was easy to install and was cut to allow a 2" perimeter for reduced trip hazards. It feels great underfoot. best grip of any pad I've used. It completely stabilized the shape of the braided rug, nothing the cheaper pads would do.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Prize

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased several sizes of rug pads and two were the Gorilla Grip pads. These were a bit thinner than the other pads, but after placing under the rugs we couldn't distinguish any difference. The significant advantage of the Gorilla Grip pad is cutting the pad to size. I could use scissors to cut these. The other pads require a sharp utility knife. All the pads have rubber grip surface and grip the floor very well. The rugs feel great when walking, sitting, or laying on them. I would purchase these again if available in the basic sizes needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of All Trades

customer_reviews.title: it's almost like it's glued to our hardwood floors
customer_reviews.text: We have a 5'x8' rug in our foyer that is not anchored by any furniture. Before getting this rug pad, that rug never stayed in place. With this rug pad, it's almost like it's glued to our hardwood floors. Even with our dog running and stopping on the rug - no movement at all. The pad is just thick enough to add a little cushion, but not thick enough to make it feel like you're walking on wall to wall carpet - at least not for our rug. Overall very satisfied with this purchase, and will be buying more for our other rugs.
customer_reviews.author: VTENGR

customer_reviews.title: Great rug pad!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this rug pad for my new Oriental rug. It worked just great for my rug that I put under my dining room table. It has a great rubber grip on the bottom of it so that the rug will stay in place. The pad adds an extra thickness to the rug so that it is more plush and cushiony. It is just what I hoped it up it would be and I will definitely buy this pad for other rugs that I buy in future. It also helps to absorb sound and it is made out of good quality material.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Raz Kiessel

customer_reviews.title: Really holds the rug in place
customer_reviews.text: Dependable adhesion for elderly family member that puts a lot of foot pressure on rug while getting in and out of bed. Even though the 1/4” pad is pretty thick, I was able to easily trim the edges back from the rug edge far enough to get a good smooth transition to the hardwood flooring underneath. Works well, looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Susan RA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My dog has gotten to the point where she needs something to provide her with traction at the head of the stairs. Therefore if the rug pad doesn't hold the carpet absolutely in place, it could turn out to be more dangerous for her than no pad at all. Gorilla Grip fills the bill perfectly. No slip. Not even a fraction of an inch. Amazing. Plus a lifetime guarantee. Will be ordering more.
customer_reviews.author: Snab

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product.
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these to go under ikea rugs which were fluffy but not padded (or non-slip). First, the gorilla grip pad is definitely noticeable, and makes the rug much more comfortable to walk or sit on. (I placed a wide strip that I cut off (I bought pad larger than I needed) under a hallway rug, and when you step on a spot where the edge of the pad is, it's definitely different.) In addition, they really do hold onto the rug and onto the floor. The pads have no smell, right out of the package, and unrolled right away--ready to use immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia_Dare

customer_reviews.title: Working So Far
customer_reviews.text: This was delivered on time and packaged so well. It was on a sturdy roll and rolled smoothly onto the floor. I used it for a runner in the foyer that I have spent many dollars on products that have not worked in keeping it from sliding around. I am cautiously optimistic that this product will work for the long haul because some of the failures worked for a while. I hope this isn’t too good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived promptly. This one cost a bit more than some of the others but it's very good quality so I am glad I chose it. The felt is very dense and compact and on the other side it has rubber to grip the floor. The rug I purchased to use it under isn't here yet so I will update and let you know how it works with the rug.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grips like a gorilla to wood floors
customer_reviews.text: I admit, this grips my area rug like a gorilla. Previously I've used other nonskid mats before, but wasn't impressed with the results. This one is well worth the cost. I vacuumed, mopped and dried my wood floor before laying this down, to make sure there wasn't any dirt or dust to prevent it from gripping the surface area. It's heavy, well made and arrived carefully rolled on a tube so it had no creases. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Me reads

customer_reviews.title: Love the cushion, hold could be better
customer_reviews.text: I have it in front of my sink in the kitchen so I got the thicker one with added cushion and you can feel the difference. The cushion is great. The pad holds well to the floor and it holds ok to the rug. It is definitely better than before we put the pad down but the rug still moves a bit. Overall I really like it and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: JulieAnn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent rug pads!!
customer_reviews.text: I now have five of these rug pads in my home. They are terrific and though not cheap, they are very good quality and much less expensive than rug pads from rug stores. These add some cushioning for my tile floors and make my rugs non slip, which the dogs love.
customer_reviews.author: Zebra

customer_reviews.title: Great carpet padding!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pad that give low pile rugs a soft feel like a plush carpet. Easy to install and trim
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: This is what you want.
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. The gorilla grip holds my thin & thick area rugs securely to the floor. My vacuum and 3 dogs can run all over the rugs and they don’t budge. It’s nice coming home and not having to fight the rug to get in the door because the dogs have skidded it against it. I appreciate that (-:
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. We bought 1 for a Turkish carpet over our house carpet (rubberized side up) and it works great. The other one we put under an old Turkish carpet over tiled floor (rubberized side down) and it not only cushions the carpet, but one can no longer see the large grout grooves between the tiles. Both carpets are held in place - no more slipping. The added cost of a .25" pad is definitely worth it over the cheaper thin ones.
customer_reviews.author: bookends

customer_reviews.title: Smells bad
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered several of these rug pads in the past and this is the first time I've had a problem with it smelling bad. I've had it for a few weeks and it still smells like sewer. I though the smell would dissipate after a while but it hasn't diminished at all. I am considering throwing it out.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: PVC Not Rubber. Product name is a lie.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it was rubber since it is named that. I finally asked customer service what it was made of and Mari said “The felt rubber rug pads are made of PVC material.” Unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: Objective Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent padding but didn't really solve the problem of my rug slipping
customer_reviews.text: I was really hopeful based on some of the reviews that this pad would solve the problem of my kitchen floor runner moving all the time. I had already tried a cheaper type of rug pad and the sticky pads you place under the corners of the rug without much improvement. This pad stays in place pretty well on the floor however the rug does not stay in place on top of the pad. I'm going to try to stick the to the pad using the adhesive pads I have to see if that helps but it definitely isn't doing anything more for the price than the cheaper options so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely NO non slip
customer_reviews.text: This rug pad was nicely constructed with felted side and rubber backing. However, it provided absolutely no non slip at all. The thing slid all over the floor just like the rug did before I put the oad underneath. Sent back.
customer_reviews.author: AP

customer_reviews.title: The only rug pad to buy - quality and value
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried other rug pads that are supposed to grip the floor but none of them worked until we got our first gorilla pad. What a difference. We just received our 6th pad. Quality is great and the rugs stay in place. Fit perfectly for both room size and runners and other smaller rugs.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine A.

customer_reviews.title: No more traveling area rugs
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these and they are the best rug pads I have ever used. I need them because I often put area rugs on wall-to-wall carpeting. The area rugs tend to inch their way out of place very quickly and were difficult for me to put back in place by myself. Since changing to these particular pads, with the rubber side up and the course “fabric” side down, the area rugs have lost their traveling rights :-)
customer_reviews.author: Janice G. Nashville

customer_reviews.title: Holds up to 2 crazy dogs running!
customer_reviews.text: My living room wood floor was getting ruined by my dogs running in and out of it to go outside. I put a run down to help and it wouldn't stay in place. Tried a different rug pad and it didn't work. Saw this and gave it a shot, its AMAZING! The rug does not move with 2 60lb dogs come running around the corner on it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Best rug mats ever!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried multiple things to stop my area rugs from moving on my hardwood floor (rug tape, those "waffle mats," etc.), but nothing worked until I bought this mat. Not only does it keep the area rug in place on my hardwood floor, it provides a really nice cushion feel to the rug. I was so impressed with the 1st mat I bought, that I ordered 2 more within a few days. I totally recommend these rugs on hardwood!!!
customer_reviews.author: c.j.

customer_reviews.title: Met expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews sold me on buying this pad and that it was made in the US. I had high hopes and they were met. The 8 x 10 fit perfectly under the new rug. Even though it was folded for shipping the pad laid flat as soon as it was opened. It was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lillie

customer_reviews.title: keeps large rug in place and more cushy too
customer_reviews.text: I have a full size wool rug that was on a ceramic tile floor in a home where 5 greyhounds also live. It was so hard to keep the rug in place with the waffle pads. This rug pad has saved my sanity and the extra cushiness of it under the wool rug is much appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: M. Susan Fischer

customer_reviews.title: My perfect rug pad
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these rug pads throughout my house, and probably will be sticking to this brand for as long as I'm buying rugs. It's so soft underfoot, and sticks really well to the floor without leaving damage. It's also really easy to cut and make adjustments for the size of your rug. Bonus that's is made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Patton

customer_reviews.title: Grips Great, Not Much Pad
customer_reviews.text: My fault. I expected .25 felt to be like thicker foam. It's not. Packaged well, arrived on time and rolls out perfectly. 6x9 pad was perfect for my 7x10 rug. BUT, I feel no difference. Use this to hold your rug in place but expect no more cushion. Probably work for some but I wanted quality. I'm going to the carpet store to buy 1" thick, 12 pound (not crappy 6 pound) foam (not bonded) pad like we use for our trade show booth. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Heather J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Quite satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2x8 for a runner. Ordered 8x10 for new wool rug in den. The pad is scheduled to be delivered today. Obviously satisfied with the 2x8 or would not have ordered another one. We are not sure how we are getting the pad and rug down and under the couches yet.
customer_reviews.author: Alabama Summer

customer_reviews.title: No more disheveled rug!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 large, high energy dogs that love to run down our foyer, hit our runner rug, and slide. The rug gripper we were using previously did nothing. I was having to rearrange the runner multiple times a day. No more! This thing is amazing! It keep the rug in place, and gives it just a bit of extra cushion. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MommatoH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hardwood protection!
customer_reviews.text: This pad is perfect! I have a large area rug on hardwood floors. It slid around and I did not want my hardwood floors damaged by the rug or someone falling when the rug slid. This pad helped my rug lay more flat and it has not slid one time since I put the pad under it. The padding is amazing and feels great as well!
customer_reviews.author: Wil

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Just the right thickness for my new shag area rug. Feels cushiony under my feet, love it. And it doesn’t shift itself or the rug. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Ebstein

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our rug feels so plush now! Easy to unroll and there were no wrinkles that needed to "flatten." No chemical smell that I have encountered with a few other pads. Great quality and made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mangum

customer_reviews.title: No cushioning at all.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it does arrive flat and looks like it doesn’t slip at all which may be important for a small rug, but mine is 8x10 anyway and wouldn’t move. But you absolutely do not feel any padding under rug. Not like foam. Just as if it’s bare rug on floor. So why bother.
customer_reviews.author: Renee E. DesRosiers

customer_reviews.title: it does a great job keeping the rug from moving
customer_reviews.text: Just what i expected, it does a great job keeping the rug from moving, and it's much more comfortable with the pad. I had to trim it to fit, and it's not easy; it helps to have someone hold the pad while you cut. A thicker pad would be even more difficult. The wooly felt gets caught in the scissors and you have to pick it out. This is not a complaint - just a warning. It was well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne M Powell

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place - even with big dogs
customer_reviews.text: We have three dogs, and they run and wrestle across our house. This is the only mat that keeps our rugs in place, even when the dogs are playing. It provides nice cushion as well. WE've definitely put this to the test over the last few months and it has delivered. Keeping our rugs in place (mostly) on top of hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I was a bit sticker shocked by the price, but decided to try it bc of all the glowing reviews. Glad I did so. Our home was built in 1890 and we have original hardwood floors throughout the entire house. For our nursery I was looking for a area rug pad to have more cushion and support. This one definitely does. In the process of replacing all our pads with this brand. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Karla A.

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this brand before and I know its good. Its not very thick but able to provide me the comfort I needed without making the carpet on top looks bulky. Offer good grip.
customer_reviews.author: KwongAMZ

customer_reviews.text: This is really nice rug pad but nowhere did it say that I would need heavy duty scissors in order to cut it to size. I ruined a couple of scissors on this and it was really hard work. Looks and feels great though.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Rosenstein

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great

It is better than having nothing underneath it and it does make it more comfortable to stand on. For normal use I think this would be a great product but if you have dogs or kids running around, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: readmore

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: Look no further! This is the one if you dont want that rug to go anywhere! We have 4 dogs and they play rough and our rug doesn't budge....finally found the perfect grip mat! Happy its made with quality material that wont damage or Hardwood floor like the plastic rubber crap and it adds a nice cushion pad underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Misty M. McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Gorilla Grip fit perfectly! Love it!!

customer_reviews.author: bob8559

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I can hardly believe it ... I’ve found something that really holds my braided rugs to my slick wood floors!! Amazing! Will be buying more of this!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this area rug pad for our 8 x 10 rug in the living room. It's just enough pad to make the rug more comfortable, but I love the fact that the rug no longer moves around - at all! We have a German Shepherd Dog, and there is no movement when she runs through the room. Also, my Samsung robot vacuum goes right over it with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Girl

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place
customer_reviews.text: This stays in place really well. I had a cheaper webbed non-slip mat under my hallway rug before, and my cats constantly moved it while they were running around. This Gorilla Grip pad stays where I put it.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan - this moves constantly and every day I am rearranging it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Rug stays put with added cushion!
customer_reviews.text: This rug grip is the answer for those who want a grip that will not damage your precious hardwood floors. My rug lays beautifully on this grip and it doesn't move. The amount of cushion makes it nice to step on. My rug is pretty thin to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Most horrific odor
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever Amazon review (after hundreds of Amazon purchases) but I feel like I need to put this out there. Currently this rug pad is airing out on my garage. The smell is absolutely horrific. I can't help but think possibly we were sent a used one? Because it legitimately smells like the bottom of a guinea pig cage. If the smell doesn't dissipate soon, this will be going back - I don't care how plush or skid-proof it is. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Connor Henderson

customer_reviews.title: I like the cushioning, but not the lint........
customer_reviews.text: Quality on install looked good. Provides much needed cushioning. However, at one end where my gamer son stands and walks a lot on, every day I'm finding lots of lint coming out from under the rug. Wish the materials were more compacted to prevent this issue.
customer_reviews.author: AIA

customer_reviews.title: Holds up against my 2 dogs
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly! I received this a day after I received my rug and for that one day my 2 dogs pushed the rug out of place several times. Since putting this underneath the rug, it has stayed put through all of my dog's shenanigans. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Vincent

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. It is nearly a quarter inch thick ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It is nearly a quarter inch thick felt pad plus has a thick layer of heavy plastic/rubber bonded to one side. My 8 by 10 piece came rolled up on a heavy cardboard tube rather than folded up and placed in a thin plastic bag like another pad I got stuck with from Amazon. My area rugs look and feel thick and plush using this pad and they do not slide around at all.
customer_reviews.author: nomdeplume

customer_reviews.title: Sensible pad. Lightweight but very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to place. Smooth, Non skid backing with soft felt . Doesn’t raise depth of the rug so my vacuum moves easily Very Sensible pad !
customer_reviews.author: solark

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a rug pad for the new rug I bought for my grandsons room in our new house. Didn't want synthetic with all of their off gases. This pad is just thick enough to make the new rug perfectly soft underfoot. The rubber on the back keeps it in place. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Stops the slide

It stopped the sliding of the rug on my vinyl plank flooring. I have a small dog that likes to retrieve and play with her toys, and the rug used to slide all over the place. It stays put now and I am very pleased with quality of this product

customer_reviews.title: Good pad for thin rugs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased three kilim rugs recently and bought these pads as well. These pads keep the rugs in place and feel soft and cushy when you walk on the rugs. I strongly recommend these pads for any thin rug. Don't bother with the waffle pads 'cause they will not keep the rug in place.
